alert.note: Alert for Erie; Niagara (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 10:42PM EST until February 22 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. .There continues to be flooding on some slower responding rivers and creeks. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Attica, Batavia, Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek At Rapids. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate flood, some residential flooding with widespread road closures in North Clarence, east into Newstead and Royalton. Water begins to back up into smaller creeks such as Ransom, Black, Beeman, Gott, and Mud Creeks. Flooding in some low lying areas along Tonawanda Creek Road, Rapids Road, and Wolcott Road, with widespread farmland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:17 PM EST Sunday the stage was 13.3 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:17 PM EST Sunday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of near 13.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.6 feet on 03/11/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1045 AM EST.
